member.remarks: This is a wrapper around a range query on the $key index in Riak. Working with secondary indices requires that users enable the LevelDB backend and restart their cluster.

member.summary: Joins two or more key-filter operations with a logical AND operation.

member.name: T:CorrugatedIron.Models.MapReduce.KeyFilters.Between`1
member.summary: Tests that the input is between the first two arguments. If the third argument is given, it is whether to treat the range as inclusive. If the third argument is omitted, the range is treated as inclusive.
member.remarks: It is assumed that left and right supply their own JSON conversion.

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakBucketProperties.SearchEnabled
member.summary: An indicator of whether search indexing is enabled on the bucket.

summary.para: Implements a writeable vector clock interface. Callers must explictly use the IWriteableVClock interface to set the vector clock value. This is by design and is implemented in an attempt to prevent developers new to Riak from causing themselves more pain. This trade off should present developers with a reliable way to explicitly drop down to mucking about with vector clocks - it becomes apparent to a casual observer that something out of the ordinary is happening.
A better understanding of the usefulness of vector clocks can be found in John Daily's Understanding Riakâ€™s Configurable Behaviors: Part 2 (http://basho.com/riaks-config-behaviors-part-2/).

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakObject.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: When saving a binary object to Riak, one of the appropriate binary should be used. If the content type is not know, fall back to application/octet-stream. In addition, when saving binary data to Riak, a charSet of null/empty string should be used. The constant CharSets.Binary should be used.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.Ping
member.summary: Ping this instance of Riak
member.description: Ping can be used to ensure that there is an operational Riak node present at the other end of the client. It's important to note that this will ping any Riak node in the cluster and a specific node cannot be specified by the user. Do not use this method to determine individual node health.
member.returns: Returns true if the Riak instance has returned a 'pong' response. Returns false if Riak is unavailable or returns a 'pang' response.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.IncrementCounter(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakCounterUpdateOptions)
member.summary: Increments a Riak counter.
member.param: The amount to increment/decrement the counter
member.remarks: Only available in Riak 1.4+. If the counter is not initialized, then the counter will be initialized to 0 and then incremented.

member.remarks: Only available in Riak 1.4+.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.Get(System.String,System.String,CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakGetOptions)
member.summary: Get the specified from the . Optionally can be read from rVal instances. By default, the server's r-value will be used, but can be overridden by rVal.
member.param: The name of the bucket containing the
The responsible for configuring the semantics of this single get request. These options will override any previously defined bucket configuration properties.
member.remarks: If a node does not respond, that does not necessarily mean that the / combination is not available. It simply means that fewer than R/PR nodes responded to the read request. See for information on how different options change Riak's default behavior.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.Get(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the specified from the . Optionally can be read from instances. By default, the server's r-value will be used, but can be overridden by .
member.param: The name of the bucket containing the
member.remarks: If a node does not respond, that does not necessarily mean that the / combination is not available. It simply means that fewer than the default number nodes responded to the read request. Unfortunatley, the Riak API does not allow us to distinguish between a 404 resulting from less than nodes successfully responding and a / combination not being found in Riak.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.Get(CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakObjectId,CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakGetOptions)
member.summary: Retrieve the specified object from Riak.
member.param: Object identifier made up of a key and bucket.
The responsible for configuring the semantics of this single get request. These options will override any previously defined bucket configuration properties.
member.remarks: If a node does not respond, that does not necessarily mean that the is not available. It simply means that fewer than nodes responded to the read request. Unfortunatley, the Riak API does not allow us to distinguish between a 404 resulting from less than nodes successfully responding and an not being found in Riak.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.Get(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakObjectId},CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakGetOptions)
member.summary: Retrieve multiple objects from Riak.
member.param: The responsible for configuring the semantics of this single get request. These options will override any previously defined bucket configuration properties.
member.returns: An of is returned. You should verify the success or failure of each result separately.
member.remarks: Riak does not support multi get behavior. CorrugatedIron's multi get functionality wraps multiple get requests and returns results as an IEnumerable{RiakResult{RiakObject}}. Callers should be aware that this may result in partial success - all results should be evaluated individually in the calling application. In addition, applications should plan for multiple failures or multiple cases of siblings being present.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.Get(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakObjectId},System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieve multiple objects from Riak.
member.param: The number of nodes required to successfully respond to the read before the read is considered a success.
member.returns: An of is returned. You should verify the success or failure of each result separately.
member.remarks: Riak does not support multi get behavior. CorrugatedIron's multi get functionality wraps multiple get requests and returns results as an IEnumerable{RiakResult{RiakObject}}. Callers should be aware that this may result in partial success - all results should be evaluated individually in the calling application. In addition, applications should plan for multiple failures or multiple cases of siblings being present.

Callers should be aware that this may result in partial success - all results should be evaluated individually in the calling application. In addition, applications should plan for multiple failures or multiple cases of siblings being present.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.DeleteBucket(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Deletes the contents of the specified .
member.returns: A of listing the success of all deletes
member.param: The number of nodes that must respond successfully to a delete request.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.DeleteBucket(System.String,CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakDeleteOptions)
member.summary: Deletes the contents of the specified .
member.returns: A of listing the success of all deletes

remarks.para: A delete bucket operation actually deletes all keys in the bucket individually. A operation is performed to retrieve a list of keys The keys retrieved from the are then deleted through .

Because of the operation, this may be a time consuming operation on production systems and may cause memory problems for the client. This should be used either in testing or on small buckets with known amounts of data.

member.summary: Perform a map reduce query and stream the results.
member.remarks: Make sure to fully enumerate the or connections may be left open.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.ListBuckets
member.summary: Lists all buckets available on the Riak cluster.
member.remarks: Buckets provide a logical namespace for keys. Listing buckets requires folding over all keys in a cluster and reading a list of buckets from disk. This operation, while non-blocking in Riak 1.0 and newer, still produces considerable physical I/O and can take a long time.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.StreamListBuckets
member.summary: Lists all buckets available on the Riak cluster. This uses an of to lazy initialize the collection of bucket names.
member.remarks: Buckets provide a logical namespace for keys. Listing buckets requires folding over all keys in a cluster and reading a list of buckets from disk. This operation, while non-blocking in Riak 1.0 and newer, still produces considerable physical I/O and can take a long time. Callers should fully enumerate the collection or else close the connection when finished.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.ListKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Lists all keys in the specified .
member.remarks: ListKeys is an expensive operation that requires folding over all data in the Riak cluster to produce a list of keys. This operation, while cheaper in Riak 1.0 than in earlier versions of Riak, should be avoided.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.StreamListKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Performs a streaming list keys operation.
member.remarks: While this streams results back to the client, alleviating pressure on Riak, this still relies on folding over all keys present in the Riak cluster. Use at your own risk. A better approach would be to use

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.ListKeysFromIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Return a list of keys from the given bucket.
member.remarks: This uses the $key special index instead of the list keys API to quickly return an unsorted list of keys from Riak.

member.name: M:CorrugatedIron.RiakClient.GetServerInfo
member.summary: Get the server information from the connected cluster.
member.returns: Model containing information gathered from a node in the cluster.
member.remarks: This function will assume that all of the nodes in the cluster are running the same version of Riak. It will only get executed on a single node, and the content that is returned technically only relates to that node. All nodes in a cluster should run on the same version of Riak.

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.RiakResult`1.Done
member.summary: Is the current paginated query done?
member.remarks: Valid for Riak 1.4 and newer only.

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.RiakResult`1.Continuation
member.summary: An opaque continuation returned if there are still additional results to be returned in a paginated query. This value should be supplied to the next query issued to Riak.
member.remarks: Valid for Riak 1.4 and newer only.

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakDeleteOptions.Rw
member.summary: The number of replicas that need to agree when retrieving the object.
member.value: The RW Value. Possible values include 'default', 'one', 'quorum', 'all', or any integer.
member.remarks: Developers looking for an easy way to set this can look at

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakDeleteOptions.Vclock
member.summary: The Vclock of the version that is being deleted. Use this to prevent deleting objects that have been modified since the last get request.
member.value: The vclock.
member.remarks: Review the information at http://wiki.basho.com/Vector-Clocks.html for additional information on how vector clocks are used in Riak.

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakDeleteOptions.R
member.summary: The number of replicas that must return before a delete is considered a succes.
member.value: The R value. Possible values include 'default', 'one', 'quorum', 'all', or any integer.
member.remarks: Developers looking for an easy way to set this can look at

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakDeleteOptions.W
member.summary: The number of replicas that must respond before a write is considered a success.
member.value: The W value. Possible values include 'default', 'one', 'quorum', 'all', or any integer.
member.remarks: Developers looking for an easy way to set this can look at

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakDeleteOptions.Pr
member.summary: Primary Read Quorum - the number of replicas that need to be available when retrieving the object.
member.value: The primary read quorum. Possible values include 'default', 'one', 'quorum', 'all', or any integer.
member.remarks: Developers looking for an easy way to set this can look at

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakDeleteOptions.Pw
member.summary: Primary Write Quorum - the number of replicas need to be available when the write is attempted.
member.value: The primary write quorum. Possible values include 'default', 'one', 'quorum', 'all', or any integer.
member.remarks: Developers looking for an easy way to set this can look at

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakDeleteOptions.Dw
member.summary: Durable writes - the number of replicas that must commit to durable storage before returning a successful response.
member.value: The durable write value. Possible values include 'default', 'one', 'quorum', 'all', or any integer.

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakGetOptions.BasicQuorum
member.summary: Basic Quorum semantics - whether to return early in some failure cases (eg. when r=1 and you get 2 errors and a success basic_quorum=true would return an error)
member.value: Whether basic quorum semantics will be used.

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakGetOptions.NotFoundOk
member.summary: Should not found responses from Riak be treated as an OK result for a find operation.

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakGetOptions.Head
member.summary: Should Riak only return object metadata
member.value: The head value.
member.remarks: This allows the user to retrieve the metadata for an otherwise large object value.

member.name: P:CorrugatedIron.Models.RiakGetOptions.Timeout
member.summary: Query timeout parameter. If a request to Riak exceeds the query timeout, Riak should stop processing the request.
